question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for display. Create a second-hand trading app page.

checklist.title: Is the core product listing functionality implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code properly implements product listings with image thumbnails, price display, and basic product information. Check if products can be sorted or filtered. Score 0 if the listing functionality is missing, 5 if basic listings are implemented but lack sorting/filtering, and 10 if comprehensive product display with filtering options is included.

checklist.title: Is the product detail view fully implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the product detail page includes high-resolution images with zoom functionality, complete product descriptions, seller information, and contact options. Verify if there are multiple product images with a gallery/carousel view. Deduct 3 points if image zoom is missing, 3 points if seller details are incomplete, and 3 points if product specifications are insufficient. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the user interaction for buying/selling implemented?
checklist.description: Review if the code includes functionality for listing a new item (with image upload, form validation), making offers, messaging between buyers and sellers, and a checkout process. Deduct 3 points if image upload is missing, 3 points for incomplete form validation, and 4 points if the messaging system is not implemented. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there a user profile and authentication system?
checklist.description: Verify if the app includes user registration, login functionality, profile management (viewing/editing user details, managing listings, tracking purchases/sales), and logout features. Deduct 3 points for missing authentication, 3 points for incomplete profile management, and 4 points if there's no transaction history feature. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code handles common abnormal situations (such as form validation errors, image loading failures, network errors, etc.) and provides friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Check for input sanitization to prevent XSS attacks and form validation before submission. Code with strong robustness should effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the user experience (e.g., 1. In-app chat with real-time notifications 2. AR view of products in your space 3. Price history graph/trend analysis 4. Condition scoring system with visual indicators). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple image uploaders) 2. Function modules unrelated to second-hand trading (e.g., a built-in game) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations or heavy background processing). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating UI components/business logic/API services), code reusability, state management implementation, and responsive design principles. Deduct 3 points if global state pollution is found; deduct 3 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 4 points if the layout breaks on different screen sizes. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times) 4) Consistent design language across all screens. Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance 4) Intuitive gestures for mobile interaction. Deduct 3 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast scrolling, and 4 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
